intro: Restio debilis, commonly known as the slender restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale blue flowers. Restio debilis typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, often in coastal dunes or near the sea. It is adapted to saline environments and is an important component of coastal vegetation.
